title: 386 build fails on my machine
body:
Running "GOARCH=386 ./all.bash" fails on my machine at tip.  64-bit works fine.  It looks like the builders are also happy.  Yet my machine fails.  What is going on?

    --- FAIL: TestIssue7573 (0.01s)
	go_test.go:257: running testgo [build -n -compiler gccgo cgoref]
	go_test.go:276: standard error:
	go_test.go:277: can't load package: package cgoref: no buildable Go source files in /tmp/gotest770440402/src/cgoref
		
	go_test.go:286: go [build -n -compiler gccgo cgoref] failed unexpectedly: exit status 1
FAIL
FAIL	cmd/go	20.901s

$ gcc --version
gcc (Ubuntu 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04) 4.8.4

@ianlancetaylor
